title: Here's what to expect when the new Desert Diamond Casino West Valley opens
summary:
CLOSEThe new Desert Diamond Casino West Valley — with more than 1,100 slot machines, 36 poker-style tables and 48 blackjack-style tables — will open at 8 p.m. Wednesday.
The $400-million, 1.2-million-square-foot casino, at 93rd and Northern avenues near Glendale's sports and entertainment district, will replace the neighboring casino that since 2015 has offered slot machines but no table games.
All slot machines, table games and restaurants will be open and ready to go, Tohono O’odham Gaming Enterprise spokeswoman Treena Parvello said in a statement.
The only other West Valley casino is Vee Quiva, near 51st Avenue on the Gila River Indian Reservation.

summary:

title: DPS trooper shoots man who pointed gun after robbery during weapons sale in Glendale
summary:
CLOSEShooting (Photo: The Republic)A state trooper shot a man who rammed his patrol car and pointed a gun while trying to get away after a robbery during an illegal weapons sale Thursday in Glendale, according to Arizona Department of Public Safety officials.
DPS troopers were alerted about 5:30 p.m. that several people were involved in the weapons sale, according to a DPS news release.
After a robbery took place during the sale, troopers tried to apprehend the suspects in the area of 91st and Montebello avenues.
The suspects tried to avoid being taken into custody by ramming the trooper's vehicle which disabled it, DPS officials said.
One of the suspects pointed a gun at the troopers, and one fired back and shot the suspect, according to DPS.

summary:

Clark reportedly broke a window and dove into the apartment, landing on two children, court paperwork shows.
Police say three officers were at the top of the stairs when Clark jumped out of the front window, yelling, "Allahu Akbar, I have a bomb."

Court records show that Clark has six prior felony convictions and was released from prison in August 2019.

title: US box office records zero takings for first time ever as coronavirus crisis bites
summary:
The US box office has recorded zero revenue for the first time in history after the country’s near total cinema shutdown in response to the coronavirus pandemic.

With major chains such as Regal and AMC shutting down last week, the halting of cinema income is far more profound.
The box office leader, according to Box Office Mojo, is the midlife-crisis comedy Phoenix, Oregon, which has taken $3,842 from 17 screens.
This appears to have mostly accrued from drive-in cinemas, with the Glendale Drive-In in Glendale, Arizona becoming Onward’s biggest-earning venue.

Most of the Phoenix area experienced showers throughout the day on Friday, the National Weather Service in Phoenix said.

title: Man sentenced to 10 years for 2018 fatal DUI crash
summary:
GLENDALE, AZ — A man was sentenced to 10 years in prison for a deadly DUI crash in Glendale.
Vincent Kaven Trevino, now 24, was sentenced Friday to 10 years in prison after pleading guilty to second-degree murder for the crash in December of 2018.
That morning, a car was stopped at a red light near the intersection of Dysart Road and Northern Avenue when Trevino struck the rear of the vehicle.
Witnesses identified Trevino as the driver and said he swerved around them and pulled away at a high rate of speed.
Trevino was on probation at the time following an arrest for failing to stay at the scene of a crash and aggravated assault in 2017.

title: Helen Rosa Lee (Rhyner) Thompson
authors: The Primary Mission Of Flash Rock Media
The Flash Today Is To Provide Residents Of
The Surrounding Cross Timbers Region A Reliable Source Of Up-To-Date News
Public Information That Is Always Free
summary:
February 14, 1928 ~ April 15, 2020 (age 92)Helen Rosa Lee Thompson was born February 14, 1928, to Morris and Ella Rhyner in Visalia, California.
She died at Good Tree Assisted Living in Stephenville, Texas on April 15, 2020 of natural causes.
She married H.C. “Dick” Thompson in 1946 and soon moved to Casper, Wyoming where Dick was employed by Standard Oil Company.
She is also survived by her 2 sisters, Connie Ozymy of Waxahachie, Texas, and Lafawn Morris of Spring, Texas.
Rosa is preceded in death by her husband, H.C. “Dick” Thompson; grandson, Joseph Paul Dennis; and brother, Carl Rhyner.

summary:
Children’s Full Moon Festival, also known as Mid-Autumn Festival, has been long celebrated by many Asian cultures between September to early October on the night of Full Moon.
On this night, children would gather lanterns, play games, receive treats, and participate in many other children related activities to celebrate the Full Moon.
The legend of the moon differs depending on the country of origin, but its concept remains the same.
The Moon Festival Celebration this year includes numerous aspects for community members to enjoy such as: food vendors (both vegetarian and savory), live music & entertainment, Dragon dance, children talent shows performed by children of various ethnic groups, and children games and contests.

GLENDALE, AZ — A child has been rushed to the hospital after nearly drowning in Glendale on Sunday.
Glendale fire officials say a one-year-old boy was found in the backyard pool of a home near 67th Avenue and Camelback Road.
When emergency responders arrived on scene, the child did not have a pulse and the boy's mother was performing CPR.
According to officials, Glendale police officers arrived on scene first and took over life-saving measures prior to fire crews' arrival.
The boy was rushed to a nearby hospital in extremely critical condition, fire officials said.

summary:
GLENDALE, AZ — A 67-year-old Glendale man has been accused of sexually abusing a young child at an in-home daycare, according to court paperwork.
Glendale police report that on October 22, they arrested Howard Blanton for multiple counts of sexual conduct with a minor.
Court records show that Blanton ran an in-home daycare center and reportedly told the girl not to say anything, or she wouldn't be allowed to play with the other daycare children.
Glendale detectives traveled to Kearny to question Blanton, who reportedly admitted to watching pornography with the girl, but denied touching her.
He is being held on a $100,000 cash bond on seven counts for sexual conduct with a minor and multiple counts of furnishing harmful materials to minors.

title: D.J. Humphries unloads about Bruce Arians’ less than flattering nickname for him
summary:
Humphries has always voiced displeasure over a nickname former Cards coach Bruce Arians gave him early in his career.
But now that Arians is no longer with the team and on the opposing sideline this weekend, Humphries decided to let his true feelings out about the name.
Early in his career, Arians gave Humphries the nickname “knee-deep” in regard to how hard he had to push Humphries during practice.
A foot wasn’t going to do it, so I nicknamed him ‘knee-deep,’” Arians told the media prior to a game during which Humphries wasn’t playing in his rookie season.
When asked if he thought the nickname was a form of bullying, Humphries said no.

“Park Aldea is a unique development for this area of Phoenix – it is the first Class A industrial project to be built in more than 10 years along this particular 10-mile stretch of the Loop 101 Freeway,” said Ryan Norris, Vice President at Trammell Crow Company.
“The industrial market is booming right now in Phoenix – there’s been three straight years of over nine million square feet of net absorption, increasing demand for Class A industrial space.
Park Aldea is easily accessible from the Loop 101 Freeway and Cardinals Way, providing access to a deep, diverse labor pool.

It includes a new airbox sealing ring (that eliminates the backfire screen), aluminum cage (that goes inside the air filter instead of on top of it) and dome-shaped air filter (that replaces the piece of toast).

If you see a white circle in the center of the air filter, re-oil the filter immediately.

title: Homicide suspect arrested after shooting near 67th Avenue and Union Hills Drive
summary:
GLENDALE, AZ — Police have made an arrest in a homicide that happened Friday, October 11 in Glendale.
Glendale police say they were called to a home in the area of 67th Avenue and Union Hills Drive around 10:15 a.m. Friday.
The shooter, 36-year-old Michael “Bubba” William Ingram, was reportedly known to the victim and forced his way into the home.
Ingram fled the scene in a vehicle but was located and arrested Tuesday.
He has been booked on one count of second-degree homicide and possession of narcotic drug.

summary:

Glendale police report that on October 17, they received a call from the homeowner of a home being remodeled near 43rd Avenue and Bethany Home Road.
The victim reportedly told police that he was watching trespassers in his home on surveillance cameras.
Upon his arrest, Vargas allegedly told police that he entered the home through a back door to explore and left once he saw the camera in the home.
Police say Vargas has a felony arrest warrant for desertion from the United States Army.

title: Here’s why the West Valley is booming
summary:
Locals know the Phoenix Metro area is divided into several overarching sub-sectors including the East Valley, West Valley and Central Phoenix.
As a member of WeMAR (West Maricopa Association of REALTORS), the West Valley is not only where I call home, but the predominant area in which I work.
For context, the West Valley is generally considered anything west of the 1-17 and encompasses, among others, the cities of Avondale, Buckeye, Glendale, Goodyear, Litchfield Park, Peoria and Surprise.
Currently, more than 1.6 million people live in the 15 communities that make up the West Valley.

title: Which Maricopa County city had the highest murder rate in 2019?
summary:

The Arizona Republic analyzed 221 deaths from January through October that the Maricopa County Medical Examiner's Office labeled as homicides.
Murder rates of Valley citiesPhoenixArizona's capital city had 6.2 homicides per 100,000 residents.
GilbertGilbert had less than one homicide per 100,000 residents with only one murder in the first 10 months of 2019.

title: Solano Vista in Glendale sells for $30.75M
summary:
CBRE has negotiated the $30.75 million sale of the 352-unit Glendale, Arizona apartment community Solano Vista.
Located at 7102 N. 43rd Ave., Solano Vista is in the high-demand and supply-constrained Glendale submarket where multifamily rental rates have increased more than 9 percent and vacancy has decreased by 97 basis points year-over-year, according to CBRE Research.
“Additionally, there is significant upside potential to increase rental revenue through interior upgrades.”“When 3rd Ave Investments acquired Solano Vista in January 2018, it was an underperforming asset in need of substantial improvements,” said Zev Hendeles, principal of 3rd Ave Investments.
3rd Ave Investments is proud to hand over the property to the buyer so they can continue building value for the tenants.”This is 3rd Ave Investments’ twelfth round-trip deal over the last four years.
The property offers excellent frontage on 43rd Avenue and proximity to Downtown Glendale and several school systems, including Grand Canyon University, Glendale Community College and Arizona State University West Campus.

title: PD: 1 dead, suspect on the loose after shooting near 19th and Glendale avenues
summary:
PHOENIX — Phoenix police are investigating a shooting near 19th and Glendale avenues Tuesday evening.
According to police, two men got into an argument in the area and one shot the other.
The suspect, who has only been identified as a male aged 20 to 35-years-old, fled northbound on foot, according police.
The suspect is still on the loose, according to Phoenix police.
Anyone with information regarding this incident is asking to call the Phoenix Police Department Violent Crimes Bureau at (602) 262-6141.

title: PD: Victim's girlfriend leads Glendale police to stabbing suspect
summary:
GLENDALE, AZ — A Valley woman led police to the man who stabbed her boyfriend earlier this month, police say.
The victim yelled at the car, when 39-year-old Derek Anthony Higuera, who mistakenly thought the victim was yelling at him, yelled back.
Police say Higuera crossed the street and came after the victim, striking him under the left arm before walking away.
The victim's girlfriend followed Higuera and pointed him out to responding officers.
Court records show that Higuera was released from prison this past November after serving a 5-year sentence for aggravated assault.

For the first time, Barrio Queen is expanding its presence to the West Valley with its first location set to open in Glendale at 7640 W. Bell Road.
The new location, set to open in early spring of 2020, will be the restaurant’s biggest yet, encompassing more than 7,000 square feet.
“We have had a lot of requests to bring the Barrio to the west side,” says Barrio Queen management.
As Barrio Queen’s menu is always evolving, the Glendale location will serve the same authentic Mexican dishes the restaurant is known for, with new additions, as well.

title: Could Cardinals be next to make 49ers-like jump in win total?
summary:
The Arizona Cardinals will have to watch as the NFC West rival San Francisco 49ers play in the Super Bowl this weekend.
The Cardinals won only five games this past season and just three the year before that.
On defense, the 49ers ranked eighth in the NFL in points allowed and second in the fewest yards allowed.
The Cardinals ranked 28th and 32nd in those categories, respectively, which points to a clear area of needed improvement for a team that otherwise had a middle-of-the-pack offense, in terms of production.
The Cardinals will have the eighth overall pick in the upcoming NFL Draft, and according to Spotrac, they’ll have the 13th most cap space entering free agency.

title: 2 brothers sentenced for 2016 Glendale murder; 3rd suspect at large
summary:
PHOENIX — Two brothers have been sentenced to prison after pleading guilty to the 2016 murder of a 21-year-old Glendale man.
Enrique Luna, 24, was sentenced to 23 years, while Israel Carrasco, 22, was sentenced to 17, the Arizona Attorney General’s Office announced Monday.
Luna, Carrasco and a third suspect who is still at large went to Christopher Cummings’ apartment in January 2016 to rob him.
The third suspect held two adults and a baby at gunpoint while Luna and Carrasco went into Cummings’ bedroom and fatally shot him.
Anyone with information related to the third suspect was asked to call Glendale Police at 623-930-3000 or Silent Witness at 480-WITNESS.

title: Glendale police arrest man on suspicion of October armed robbery
summary:
CLOSESamuel Rivard (Photo: Maricopa County Sheriff's Office)Glendale police arrested a man on Wednesday in connection with an armed robbery of a liquor store in October, according to a Facebook post by the Glendale Police Department.
Police say they arrested Samuel Rivard, 31, after matching his tattoos to the ones visible in the security footage from the robbery.
On the morning of Oct. 15, 2019, a man matching Rivard's description pointed a small silver handgun at a liquor-store clerk and demanded money out of the liquor-store register, according to the police post.
Just before noon Wednesday, police say they got a call that a man matching the description of the suspect from the robbery was spotted at 63rd Avenue and Bell Road, the same area where the liquor store was robbed.
Rivard was booked on one count of armed robbery as well as three other drug charges.

But with Edmonds on ice over the last few weeks of games, Arizona has reduced Johnson’s role.
For the record, Edmonds believes Kingsbury’s up-tempo offense will run enough plays within each game to give the three running backs a good share of opportunity.

summary:
The Arizona Cardinals appear to have protected themselves well if worst-case injury scenarios strike newly-extended left tackle D.J.
So even though his 2021 salary will be fully guaranteed when that NFL season officially begins, the Cardinals would have preserved the cap space if they release him.
Humphries’ contract had a $2.4 million signing bonus that pro-rates, spreading out as a $800,000 hit to the salary cap in each of the next three seasons.

title: Arizona Coyotes’ Phil Kessel plays 1000th career game
summary:
Forward Phil Kessel, in just his fourth game with the Coyotes, played his 1000th career game.
He became the 13th player in team history to play his 1000th game in a Coyotes uniform.
He’s the 338th player in NHL history to reach the milestone, and the 47th American to do so.
Kessel played 20:45 and had three shots on goal in the Coyotes’ game on Saturday.
The Coyotes will have a ceremony for Kessel’s 1000th game before the game against the Ottawa Senators on Oct. 19.

title: SRS Negotiates Sale of 119,525-Square-Foot Glendale Galleria in Arizona
summary:
Glendale, Ariz. — SRS Real Estate Partners’ Investment Properties Group has arranged the sale of Glendale Galleria, a neighborhood shopping center located at 5880 W. Peoria Ave. in Glendale.
Brixmor Property Group sold the asset to a Florida-based private investor for an undisclosed price in a 1031 exchange.

title: 94-year-old veteran dies after cross-country trip with Glendale officer to see family in Florida
summary:
GLENDALE, AZ — Glendale police say a WWII veteran who was escorted to see his family in Florida by a sergeant has died.
Earlier this month, ABC15 reported on 94-year-old Howard Benson, a Glendale resident who wanted to drive himself to Florida, all by himself, to be closer to family.
His family called the Glendale Police Department, asking them to persuade Howard from going alone, but the WWII veteran was determined to go on one final mission.
"For the next three days, we went through 94 years of history of Howard Benson and he told me everything about his life.
He got one more birthday and one more Veteran's Day...Our condolences to the Benson family; he will be missed," the department said on Twitter.

title: Say it isn't so: Another storm predicted to bring rain on Thanksgiving Day

Rogers said to expect lows in the mid to upper 40s each day with Saturday temperatures predicted to drop to the low 40s.
A significant winter storm with major travel impacts is looking more likely for Thanksgiving into Friday.
The National Weather Services advises people to keep up to date on the latest forecast and be flexible with their travel plans.

CLOSEHeavy rains that moved into the Phoenix area Tuesday afternoon were expected to continue throughout Wednesday and even into Thursday, the National Weather Service said.
Temperatures on Wednesday in Phoenix were expected to stay in the mid- to upper-60s in the Phoenix area, with another half-inch to an inch of rain expected, the Weather Service said.
By Tuesday night, the entire Phoenix metro had received some measurable rain, with most areas receiving between 0.10-0.20 of an inch of rain.
The metro Phoenix area can expect about 1½ to 2 inches of rainfall in total through Thursday, the Weather Service said.
Daytime temperatures in the Phoenix area will peak in the mid-60s through Friday.

title: RUMORS, GOSSIP & UNFOUNDED TRUTHS: IT’S ALL ABOUT THE RIDING, NOT WORRYING ABOUT WHO WON WHAT
summary:
The 2020 Yamaha YZ450F has the worst ergonomics of all the 2020 450 motocross bikes.
First, run a Twin Air YZ450F air filter (part number 152221).
It includes a new airbox sealing ring (that eliminates the backfire screen), aluminum cage (that goes inside the air filter instead of on top of it) and dome-shaped air filter (that replaces the piece of toast).
If you don’t replace the stock air filter with the Twin Air design, be sure to check it constantly.
If you see a white circle in the center of the air filter, re-oil the filter immediately.

title: Glendale's Mountain Ridge High School marching band celebrates big championship win
summary:
GLENDALE, AZ — The Lions of Mountain Ridge High School have plenty to celebrate after winning the state marching band championship.
The Mountain Ridge High School Band program in Glendale is known nationally for performances at the Mid-west Clinic, the Music for All National Concert Band Festival, and across the State of Arizona as a five-time recipient of Arizona Band and Orchestra Director's Association’s William E. Richardson Program of Distinction Award.
This year's "Out of the Blue" program proved to be the perfect show to deliver the school's first ABODA State Marching Band Championship win on Saturday, November 16.
The Pride of the West, under the direction of Mr. Aaron Vogel, also earned special caption awards for the Most Outstanding Visual, Auxiliary, General Effect, and Musical Performance.

title: FD: Workers escape after trapped in truck with telephone lines down
summary:
GLENDALE, AZ — Two sanitation workers had to be rescued from inside a dump truck after telephone lines fell on top of it Wednesday.
Glendale firefighter say the lines were sagging because a car crashed into a power pole nearby.
Crews originally thought the lines were energized, but later learned they were telephone lines so nobody was in danger.
The report of lines down was telecommunication lines.

Officers responded to a reported shooting at 2:35 p.m. on 25th Drive, near Glendale Avenue and Interstate 17, Phoenix police officials said in an email.
The woman was taken to a hospital with a non-life threatening injury.
Police did not release any details about the shooter or how the woman was shot.

title: Penalties, special teams bite Coyotes in loss to Blue Jackets
summary:
GLENDALE, Ariz. — Arizona Coyotes head coach Rick Tocchet admitted he thought his own team was the one shooting itself in the foot after its lost 3-2 to the Columbus Blue Jackets on Thursday.
It was shooting ourself in the foot.”As Tocchet said, the Coyotes have blown a lead in back-to-back games.
A lot of it came down to penalties, as Arizona took six penalties on Tuesday and four on Thursday, giving up three power play goals combined across those two games.
Just dumb penalties.”Penalties or not, Arizona’s game against Columbus on Thursday wasn’t a work of art.
Arizona got a late power play and had a 6-on-4 advantage with goaltender Darcy Kuemper pulled, but the Coyotes didn’t score.

title: Phoenix woman accused of reckless manslaughter in car crash
summary:
GLENDALE, AZ — Police in Glendale say a Phoenix woman has been accused of reckless manslaughter after the vehicle she was driving hit a wall and killed the passenger.
They say 24-year-old Evangelina Elizabeth Lara was arrested after Sunday night's crash.
According to witnesses, Lara passed several vehicles before losing control of her car and it ran into a residential block wall.
Police say 25-year-old Cristian Ramos of Phoenix was a passenger in the vehicle and pronounced dead at the scene.
They say Lara was treated at a hospital for minor injuries before being booked into jail on suspicion of reckless manslaughter.

title: Arizona Rattlers announce 2020 season schedule
summary:
GLENDALE, AZ — The Indoor Football League (IFL) announced Tuesday the Arizona Rattlers schedule for the 2020 season.
The Rattlers will kick off the season in Moline, Illinois against Quad City Steamwheelers on March 21.
They will make their first home appearance on Sunday, April 5 as they take on their in-state rival, the Tucson Sugar Skulls at Talking Stick Resort Arena.
The team will face off against the defending United Bowl Champions, Sioux Falls Storm on the road, Sunday, April 26.
Since the league has expanded to 13 teams in the 2020 season, the IFL will now have eight teams in the playoffs, beginning July 4 weekend.

title: 3 people hurt after transformer fire near Glendale gas station
summary:
CLOSEBreaking news (Photo: The Republic)Three men were hurt after a transformer caught fire near a Glendale gas station on Monday morning, according to the Glendale Fire Department.
According to Ashley Losch with the Glendale Fire Department, a contract crew hired through the Salt River Project was working on the transformer at 67th and Olive avenues when the fire started.
Two of the men were flown to a local hospital with severe burns and a third man was moderately burned and taken by ground to a hospital, Losch said.
The company is working to fix the transformer and limit outages in the area, according to SRP spokeswoman Kathleen Mascarenas.
The incident occurred around 9 a.m., and SRP's outage map showed an estimated 84 customers power were affected by the transformer fire.

Glendale Police said he was located Friday morning and returned home.
Police said Garcia suffers from dementia, a heart condition and requires insulin.

Glendale police responded just before 10:15 a.m. to a house in the 6900 block of West Utopia Road.

title: Past two months in Phoenix were cloudiest November and December in nearly 20 years
summary:
The past two months were the cloudiest November and December in Phoenix in at least 19 years.
Isaac Smith, a meteorologist with the National Weather Service, said multiple weather systems moved through the area this fall and winter, bringing rainfall.
On average, Phoenix is cloudy about 38% of the time during the last two months of the year.
Phoenix is one of the sunniest cities in the United States, according to NOAA data.
Tucson and Flagstaff also are among the sunniest cities in the country.

According to officials with the Maricopa County Sheriff's Office, the shooting happened at the gas station near Dysart Road and Glendale Avenue in Litchfield Park around 8 p.m.MCSO says a man who had been shot was taken to the hospital in an unknown condition.
The shooter reportedly remained at the scene and is cooperating with detectives.
This is an active and ongoing investigation, according to MCSO.

title: PD: Man arrested following 48-hour violent crime spree in Glendale
summary:
GLENDALE — The Glendale Police Department has arrested a man they say was involved in a violent crime spree in which he sexually assaulted a woman and allegedly committed three separate armed robberies.
According to police, 32-year-old Jer'Marion Moses Imasuku was arrested on November 6 around 2 p.m. near 51st and Glendale avenues following a 48-hour crime spree in the city.
The victim told police she was walking her puppy down the street when Imasuku allegedly "drove up to her quickly and stunned her with his car door."
Imasuku allegedly took the woman to another location where sexually assaulted her and attempted to murder her twice, Glendale police say.
Later in the night, Glendale police responded to the armed robbery of a Motel 6 near 59th and Glendale avenues.

title: Glendale votes against giving city council members hefty raises
summary:
PHOENIX — Glendale voters said no to a proposition that would have given the mayor and the rest of the city council hefty raises.
About 75% of voters were against Proposition 424, which would have raised the annual salary for council members to 1% less than the median annual salary for Glendale city employees.
The pay increase would have begun on Jan. 1, 2020, and would have raised the annual salary for Glendale Mayor Jerry Weiers from $48,000 to $68,490, and council members from $34,000 to $52,685.
Those against the proposition said the part-time nature of the positions and the fact several city council members have full-time jobs meant they didn’t need the extra money.
Proponents of the pay increase said that Weiers and the City Council have earned it with their recent performance.

summary:

title: Helen Rosa Lee (Rhyner) Thompson
authors: The Primary Mission Of Flash Rock Media
The Flash Today Is To Provide Residents Of
The Surrounding Cross Timbers Region A Reliable Source Of Up-To-Date News
Public Information That Is Always Free
summary:
February 14, 1928 ~ April 15, 2020 (age 92)Helen Rosa Lee Thompson was born February 14, 1928, to Morris and Ella Rhyner in Visalia, California.
She died at Good Tree Assisted Living in Stephenville, Texas on April 15, 2020 of natural causes.
She married H.C. “Dick” Thompson in 1946 and soon moved to Casper, Wyoming where Dick was employed by Standard Oil Company.
She is also survived by her 2 sisters, Connie Ozymy of Waxahachie, Texas, and Lafawn Morris of Spring, Texas.
Rosa is preceded in death by her husband, H.C. “Dick” Thompson; grandson, Joseph Paul Dennis; and brother, Carl Rhyner.

title: Freeze warning issued for north Phoenix, Glendale, Cave Creek and Deer Valley areas
summary:
A freeze warning will be in effect Saturday night for communities in the north Phoenix and Glendale areas, the Cave Creek and New River area and in Deer Valley, according to the National Weather Service in Phoenix.
A hard freeze warning, where temperatures drop to 28 degrees or less, was issued for the Casa Grande area.
A Weather Service forecast says "the coldest temperatures of this winter season so far are likely across much of south-central Arizona."
According to the forecast, low temperatures Sunday night will be in the mid- to upper 30s and in the 40s on Monday and Tuesday.
The Freeze warning for tonight includes the greater #Phoenix area and the Hard Freeze Warning includes Casa Grande with a forecast low of 28° for Sunday morning.

title: Glendale puts 250 panhandlers to work
summary:
Phoenix Rescue Mission and the city of Glendale recently surpassed the one-year mark of the launch of Glendale Works, an integrated workforce development program aimed at reducing homelessness in Glendale by providing homeless individuals day work cleaning city property.
“We’ve connected more than 250 panhandlers and homeless individuals with services designed to end their cycle of homelessness,” Nathan Smith, Phoenix Rescue Mission’s Director of Community Engagement, said.
The participants work with Phoenix Rescue Mission and the city’s Parks Division to conduct beautification projects – removing trash and performing landscaping duties in city parks, trails and washes.
“We’ve spent the past year refining our Will Work program, which is the foundation of Glendale Works and can be scaled for any city, no matter the city’s size or situation,” Smith said.
Phoenix Rescue Mission is also partnering with the cities of Peoria, Goodyear and Avondale on similar public-private programs that address food insecurity, crime and other social issues.

title: No burning allowed on New Year's Eve or New Year's Day in Maricopa County
summary:
(Photo: Anchiy, Getty Images/iStockphoto)Those looking to ring in the new year next to a cozy fireplace will have to find an alternative, as authorities declared New Year's Eve and New Year's Day no-burn days in Maricopa County.
Officials issued a High Pollution Advisory for Dec. 31 and Jan. 1, according to the Maricopa County Air Quality Department.
The department said there should be no wood burning, leaf-blowing or off-roading vehicles on those days, adding that air quality in the county would be unhealthy for sensitive groups.
MORE: Maricopa County has gotten hundreds of complaints on no-burn daysThose wanting to report a violation of the order can reach the department's hotline at 602-372-2703 or fill out an online form.
